items.summary: Add a static, no-JavaScript reachability check page that can be loaded directly (e.g., `/health.html`) and displays the current build identifier (from the existing build ID metadata) so the user can distinguish DNS/hosting failures from in-app runtime failures.

Add a user-accessible “Performance check” section to the existing in-app diagnostics UI that reports basic page-load timing (e.g., time-to-app-mounted using the existing `app-mounted` signal, plus browser navigation timing when available) and includes a one-click copy-to-clipboard output for support/debugging.

Ensure the boot fallback screen user-facing text remains clear and consistent for the three failure modes it already detects (resource/script load failure, network/connection issue, runtime error), and includes the build identifier in all non-success states so the user can report exactly what they saw.
